title: Drawing, "Design for a Cartel Clock", 1700–15
medium: Pen and black ink; brush and black, rose and green wash on two sheets of off-white laid paper, joined horizontally
creditline: Purchased for the Museum by the Advisory Council
description: Drawing of a clock, to scale in elevation. Above the face, a medallion bust portrait all surmounted by a globe, hour glass and calipers. The lower portion is made up of an architectural element with rams' heads  and terminating at the bottom in a finial.

tombstone.epitaph:
Drawing, "Design for a Cartel Clock", 1700–15.
1700–15. Pen and black ink; brush and black, rose and green wash on two sheets of off-white laid paper, joined horizontally. Purchased for the Museum by the Advisory Council. 1911-28-227.
